adm:managed-object.name: local-db-index
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis: are used to store information that makes it possible to locate entries very quickly when processing search operations.
adm:managed-object.adm:description: Indexing is performed on a per-attribute level and different types of indexing may be performed for different kinds of attributes, based on how they are expected to be accessed during search operations.

adm:property.name: attribute
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the name of the attribute for which the index is to be maintained.

adm:property.name: index-entry-limit
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the maximum number of entries that are allowed to match a given index key before that particular index key is no longer maintained.
adm:property.adm:description: This is analogous to the ALL IDs threshold in the Sun Java System Directory Server. If this is specified, its value overrides the JE backend-wide configuration. For no limit, use 0 for the value.

adm:other.adm:synopsis: If any index keys have already reached this limit, indexes must be rebuilt before they will be allowed to use the new limit.

adm:property.name: index-type
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the type(s) of indexing that should be performed for the associated attribute.
adm:property.adm:description: For equality, presence, and substring index types, the associated attribute type must have a corresponding matching rule.

adm:other.adm:synopsis: If any new index types are added for an attribute, and values for that attribute already exist in the database, the index must be rebuilt before it will be accurate.

adm:value.name: equality
adm:value.adm:synopsis: This index type is used to improve the efficiency of searches using equality search filters.

adm:value.name: ordering
adm:value.adm:synopsis: This index type is used to improve the efficiency of searches using "greater than or equal to" or "less then or equal to" search filters.

adm:value.name: presence
adm:value.adm:synopsis: This index type is used to improve the efficiency of searches using the presence search filters.

adm:value.name: substring
adm:value.adm:synopsis: This index type is used to improve the efficiency of searches using substring search filters.

adm:value.name: approximate
adm:value.adm:synopsis: This index type is used to improve the efficiency of searches using approximate matching search filters.

adm:value.name: extensible
adm:value.adm:synopsis: This index type is used to improve the efficiency of searches using extensible matching search filters.

adm:property.name: substring-length
adm:property.adm:synopsis: The length of substrings in a substring index.

adm:other.adm:synopsis: The index must be rebuilt before it will reflect the new value.

adm:property.name: index-extensible-matching-rule
adm:property.adm:synopsis: The extensible matching rule in an extensible index.
adm:property.adm:description: An extensible matching rule must be specified using either LOCALE or OID of the matching rule.

adm:other.adm:synopsis: The index must be rebuilt before it will reflect the new value.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: No extensible matching rules will be indexed.
